intro: Thymus pallidus subsp. cossonianus, commonly known as the Cossonian thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, gray-green leaves that are aromatic and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its essential oils contain thymol and other compounds, contributing to its use in herbal medicine and aromatherapy.
